definition:
Data which provide information about or 
predict the overall health of the economy or the financial markets, 
examples are inflation, interest rates, employment, etc.
opposite_reasoning: EconomicIndicator lacks a direct antonym, but its core semantic properties (objective, quantifiable, empirical, data-driven) are best opposed by subjective, unmeasured assessments. This opposition captures the objective↔subjective distinction which is both semantically coherent and useful for AI safety applications (distinguishing factual metrics from opinions/biases). While SubjectiveAssessment may not exist as a formal SUMO term, the concept is clear and should be added. Fallback to QualitativeAttribute (likely in SUMO) or PersonalExperience (broader but available) provides robust alternatives.
